body.p: To His Excellency, the Governor of Kentucky

J. M. Quinton ^Your petitioner^ States that about the 14th day of August, 1863, he was fined thirty dollars in the Police Court of Harrodsburg for a breach of the peace. Said alledged offence growing out of a fight between your petitioner and one Emanuel Garcia, a Mexican, and for a long time a Soldier in John H Morgan's command. Your petitioner further states that the said Emanuel Garcia while attached to the command of Morgan, during one of his raids into Kentucky, come to the house of your petitioner_ during his absence and while he was a refugee from home on account of his Union principles and Searched for your petitioner and insultingly demanded of his wife to make Known his whereabouts, at the same time making threats &c-, and that afterwards when Said Garcia had deserted Morgan and come home your petitioner meeting him asked him about his conduct at his house and that in receiving an insulting reply Your petitioner whipped the native Mexican and rebel deserter; and that the breach of the peace charged consisted in this. J. M. Quinton further states that at the time Such insults were offered to his family he was, and is now, a discharged Union Soldier, having served in the 19th" Ky regiment under Col. Landrum
for nearly a year and discharged on account of physical disability. On account of these facts he asks of your Excellency a favorable consideration in his behalf J. M. Quinton states on oath he believes the statements in the foregoing petitions are true Sworn to before me this 3 December 1863 and that his knowledge of said Garcia being at his house is based on information of his family; the other statements of the petition he knows to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3 December 1863.

John G. Kyle
Police Judge of Harrodsburg
We the undersigned citizens of Mercer County would urge and request Your Excellency to remit the fine of J. M. Quinton, believing him to be especially an object of clemency.

J. W. Frapnall
O S Poston
Thos Edwards PJMCC
J. L. Smedley
John G. Kyle
James D. Hardin
G. S. Abner
Richard Board C. M. C. C
W. E. Riley
George Frapnall

Harrodsburg ky
Decr 16 1863
Governor Bramlette
Dear Sir
I present the enclosed petition for your consideration and executive clemency Trusting that at an early day you will give it a perusal

Respectfully
Your friend
O S Poston

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
